comments.body: Why `pop` things off `module.params` if your new `params` are just starting from scratch?

So if a credential specifies both a vault password and an ssh key, we can't really help them because these split into 2 credentials in the migration. But the credential lookup will be by name... so hopefully vault is the one that kept the old name in these cases?

https://github.com/ansible/awx/blob/9dbcc5934ee1a5774cec58b8f4ce08bea777dd7e/awx/main/migrations/_credentialtypes.py#L126

I can't figure out what happened to the names in this case.

Oh, but credentials are `CommonModelNameNotUnique`. So the one thing that's clear is that this case is pretty hopeless.

Yep, that's probably about the best we can do - this is what the v1 compat shim in the API itself does.  For people who have playbooks that specify ssh password *and* vault password within one task, they'll just have to update their playbooks two do separate tasks - this was a breaking API change.

super minor, but the team attribute isn't actually idempotent

(not work fixing)
I wouldn't hold up this backport for this, personally.
no, it's probably not fixable anyway

                team = team_res.get(name=module.params.get('team'))
                params['team'] = team['id']

            if module.params.get('ssh_key_data'):

comments.body: From a style standpoint, this should be done a different way (it mutates an input rather than making the change in a scoped variable) but if we need to get this in quickly (for the 2.5.0 and 2.4.4 releases) then I won't block on it.  Just something to remember to fix later.

                with open(filename, 'rb') as f:
                    module.params['ssh_key_data'] = f.read()
